title: validation failed on upgraded 5.0-5 on cluster.xml
description:
STEPS:
1. install 5.0-4
2. upgrade to 5.0-5
3. validate clusters.xml:

Error:
--------

changeHistory.comment:
Brian,

Hopefully this is simpe .. add logic to validate.xqy (or add to schema) to support cluster-id. Please give this priority
Brian, if you need help for this, ask Mary, she is the schema expert.

Brian, this is what it turns out to be:

- clusters.xsd defines security-version as a mandatory element
- The upgrade code is updating the security-version inclusters.xml only in the scenario when security DB is being replicate.

If our intent is not to make security-version mandatory, then we should change the schema to define it as optional. If the intent is really to make it required, then we upgrade code should make sure it always update security-version.
IMHO, we should make it optional (minOccurs="0" I think).
We want the security version to always exist in the config file.

Latest fix from Bug 16382 ( http://bugtrack.marklogic.com/16382 ) writes security version to clusters.xml in all cases. 

Closing this bug?
Verified on linux64 cluster on upgraded environment on 02/05 build. The test validate-ml-xml-files.xml passed. But  I will wait for windows machine behaviour before closing the bug.
Verified on ML version 20130207 on upgraded environment on win64 cluster as well and the test validate-ml-xml-files.xml is passing. Hence, shipping the bug.
